Dear Tajuanda Carey:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Brittany Cowans, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Title Sufficiency of staff.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The facility does not have staffing to address Youth A behaviors.
Investigation DCWL Consultant was interviewed over the phone on
3/14/2025. DCWL Consultant reported she has not received any
communication from the agency of law enforcement being
involved for the month of March 2025.
Staff 1 was interviewed during an unannounced visit at the
facility on 3/14/2025. Staff 1 reported on 3/11/2025, she was
cleaning in the kitchen while Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C were
in the den watching television. The television was loud, and Staff 5
asked them to turn it down and neither youth listened to Staff 5.
She recalls Youth B threw a remote and chair at Youth A and they
began to fight. Staff 1 separated Youth A off of Youth B and Staff
4 helped Youth B, as they both were on the floor. Youth B was
holding onto Youth A’s hair during the fight. Both youths were
separated and were able to be calmed down by staff.
After the incident, Youth B threw Youth A’s shoes in a ditch that
was full of water. Staff 1 went to retrieve the shoes. Youth A
learned of this happening and told Staff 3 she wanted to file a
police report. As Youth A was getting ready to leave to go to the
police station, she ran back into the house and ran into Youth B’s
bedroom, but Youth B was not inside. Youth B then ran into her
bedroom, and they began to fight again. Staff 1 and Staff 3 were
able to break them up again. Staff 3 was able to pull Youth A off of
Youth B and Staff 1 stopped Youth B from fighting again.
Staff 1 reported that all staff received an email on 3/14/2025
regarding Youth A’s safety plan that was dated for 3/3/2025,
however, a safety plan was not provided prior to 3/14/2025. She
did not recall any other incidents with Youth A and other.
2

Program Manager was interviewed during an unannounced
visit at the facility on 3/14/2025. Program Manager reported she
was not at the facility when Youth A and Youth B got into their
altercation, however, she arrived right before the police arrived at
the facility. She is only aware that Youth A refused to seek
treatment after the altercation. Program Manager reported there
have been many incidents with Youth A since she arrived on
2/19/2025. She did not report how many incidents she was
present for that involved Youth A. She reported there is a safety
plan for Youth A that was emailed on 3/14/2025 to all staff.
Staff 2 was interviewed during an unannounced visit at the
facility on 3/14/2025. Staff 2 reported she is only aware of one
incident that happened on 3/8/2025 that involved Youth A. During
this incident, Youth A and Youth B were assumed to be under the
influence of THC as both youth have a history of being under the
influence of substances. Youth A and Youth B were sitting in the
den, playing with a water bottle. Staff 3 stated that Youth A
sprayed her with water from the water bottle. The police were
called and picked up both Youth A and Youth B and brought them
back around noon on the same day. Staff 3 reported that Youth A
does have a safety plan. All staff members received Youth A's
safety plan via email on 03/14/2025. She reported that there are
no concerns with staff intervening when an incident occurs.
Staff 3 was interviewed during an unannounced visit at the
facility on 3/14/2025. Staff 3 reported there was an incident
between Youth A and Youth B on 3/11/2025. She stated she
heard yelling in the den and saw Youth A and Youth B in a
physical fight. She stated Staff 1, Staff 4 and herself broke up the
fight and separated the two youth. Staff 3 talked to Youth A and
was able to calm her down. Youth A reported to her that she
wanted to press charges against Youth B. Therefore, Staff 3 told
Staff 5 to take Youth A to the police station to press charges. She
then went into the den to check on Youth B who had calmed down
and Youth B wanted to speak to Youth A about making up. Youth
A was already in the van at this time. Youth A then ran into the
facility and kicked down Youth’s B bedroom door, but no one was
in the room. Youth B then ran into her bedroom and both youth
began to fight by pulling on each other. Staff 3 was able to get
them separated and told Staff 4 to call the police. When the police
arrived, Youth A made a report, and the police took Youth B. Staff
3 stated she had not reviewed a safety plan for Youth A at this
time. Staff 3 has not had any other incidents with Youth A as she
has only been working for 2 weeks.
3

Youth A was interviewed during an unannounced visit at the
facility on 3/14/2025. Youth A stated that she got into a fight with
Youth B due to the volume of the television and Youth B throwing
her shoes in a ditch full of water. When she found out that Youth B
threw her shoes by a staff member, she did not recall which staff,
she went into Youth B’s room, and she was going to also throw
Youth B’s shoes in the water but decided to flip a box of colored
pencils instead. Youth B ran into her room and began beating on
Youth A and staff separated them. She stated the police were
called and she gave them a statement. The police took a picture
of her face and scalp. Youth A stated that her scalp was bleeding
from some of her hair being pulled out and she already had a
black eye from a fight with Youth E. She stated she had some
bruises on her hand, and a scratch on her face. She stated she
did refuse to seek medical treatment. Youth A reported that her
fight with Youth E involved her and Youth E arguing about Youth
E not taking her side in an argument involving a guy. She stated
that she initially walked away but she started yelling at Youth E
and Youth E punched her in the face. The police were called and
Youth A refused medical treatment. Youth A reported that she got
into a fight with Youth C about the shower. She stated that Youth
C left her hair in the shower and Youth C cleaned the floor but not
the tub. She asked Youth C to clean out the tub and Youth C
shoved a broom in her face that hair from the bathroom on it. She
stated that they both fought each other, and the police came.
Youth C was taken away by the police. She reported that staff did
intervene and separated them. Youth A also reported that on an
unknown date, Youth B and her were under the influence of
marijuana and they both sprayed water on staff and the police
took her to the police station. She does not recall the staff who
were involved. She did not recall any other incidents with staff or
youth. Youth A did not recall any dates but said the incidents
happened sometime in March 2025. Youth A reported that she
likes the staff, and staff communicates with her when she is upset.
She feels as if she does have the support of staff and this is why
she feels safe at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed during an announced visit at the
facility on 4/11/2025. Youth B stated there was an incident a
month ago, where Youth A, Youth C, and her were in the den
watching television and Youth A was on her computer. Youth A
had her computer volume all the way up and Youth B turned the
television all the way up. Youth C asked her to turn the television
down, and she told Youth C to tell Youth A to turn her music down
and then she would turn the television down. Youth A said, “I don’t
give a fuck”. Youth B got up from the couch and said to Youth A,
4

“you don’t give a fuck”, and then proceeded to throw a chair, book
and remote at Youth A. They began fighting and fell to the floor.
They each had a handful of each other’s hair, and the fight was
broken up by Staff 4 and Staff 5. While Youth A was in her
bedroom, Youth B saw Youth A’s shoes in the living room and
threw them in a ditch that was full of water. When Youth A found
out about her shoes, she ran into Youth B’s bedroom and started
throwing her stuff around. Youth B began fighting her again and
was broken up by Staff 4 and Staff 5. The police came and
arrested Youth B for assault and battery. She went to JDF for six
days. Youth B reported that her and Youth A are back being
friends again and are now roommates
.
Youth C was interviewed during an unannounced visit at the
facility on 3/14/2025. Youth C reported that she only recalls two
incidents that she’s had with Youth A. Youth A stated that on an
unknown date, she was sitting on the couch and Youth A came
into the den and told her to “clean up yo nappy hair” because
there was hair in the tub. Youth A threw a broom at Youth C and
Youth C punched Youth A in the face. Staff were able to break
them apart. Youth C also reported that on an unknow date, Youth
A was arguing with her because Youth A was upset about the dirty
dishes in the sink. Youth A said, “so we about to crash out” and
both youths began to physically fight. Youth C stated that the
police were called, and she was taken away but was brought back
to the facility after about an hour. She doesn’t recall the dates or
staff involved in the two incidents. She could not recall other
incidents with Youth A or other youth. Youth C reported that staff
do not get physical with them and will tell them to go to their room
as a form of discipline.
Youth D was interviewed during an unannounced visit at the
facility on 3/14/2025. Youth D reported that she is only aware of
one incident with Youth A. She stated that sometime last week,
Youth A and Youth C got into a fight because Youth A threw a
broom at Youth C. Youth C would not let go off Youth A’s hair and
staff had to convince Youth C to let go of Youth A’s hair. Youth D
also reported that she has not had any incidents with any youth at
the facility. She reported that staff are not allowed to touch them
and will try to talk to youth. If there is a physical fight, staff will call
the police.
Attempts were made to interview Youth E on 3/14/2025 and
4/11/2025, but Youth E refused both attempts.
5

Staff 4 was interviewed during an announced visit at the
facility on 4/11/2025. Staff 4 reported that Youth A, Youth B and
Youth C were in the den while she was in the living room. The
television in the den was loud and she got up and asked the youth
why the television was so loud. Youth B stated that Youth A’s
music was loud. Youth A told Youth B that she “does not give a
fuck”. Youth B threw a remote and a chair at Youth A. Youth A
dropped her computer and both youths began to fight. Staff 4 and
5 had to break up the fight. Youth A was on top of Youth B, and
each were holding onto each other’s hair. Once Staff 3 and herself
broke up the fight, Youth A went into her room and told Staff 4 that
she wanted to press charges on Youth B. Youth B remained in the
den. While Youth A was getting ready to leave, Youth B and Youth
C, saw Youth A’s shoes in the den and threw Youth A’s shoes
outside in the ditch full of water that is next to the driveway. Youth
A found out from Staff 5 that her shoes were in the ditch and got
out of the van and ran back into the facility to Youth B’s bedroom.
Youth B ran into her room and both youths began to fight again.
The police were called, however, Staff 4 is unsure who called
them. The police arrested Youth B and Staff 4 had to provide a
statement to the police. Staff 4 did not have any concerns
regarding staffs ability to respond to youth.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed over the phone on
4/24/2025. The CA reported that she was not present for any
incidents that involved Youth A.
Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone on 5/5/2025. Staff 5
reported she was in the kitchen when she heard Youth A and B
yelling at one another in the den. She was unsure what they were
upset about. She stated that Staff 4 stepped in between them and
then Staff 3 and herself entered the den. She saw Youth B leap
over Staff 4 and either hit Youth B or threw something at her. The
youth began to fight and Staff 3, 4 and herself were able to
separate them. Afterwards, Youth A told Staff 3 that she wanted to
press charges and Staff 3 asked her to take Youth A to the police
station. Staff 3 and herself were standing outside the van
discussing where Youth A shoes were and she believes Youth A
overheard their conversation. She did not tell Youth A that her
shoes were in the water. Youth A got out the van and saw her
shoes in the pool of water and became upset, however, she was
able to be calmed down by Staff 3. She stated that once Youth A
was calm, she did not show any signs that she was going to go in
the house and have another altercation with Youth B. Youth A
calmly walked into the house but she was not present for the
second altercation. She received Youth’s A safety plan via email
6

on 3/19/2025 and it is also posted in the staff office. She stated
the facility may need more staff to handle all the youth behaviors
because the youth have recently been very aggressive. She
stated that Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and Youth E are difficult to
handle and refuse to do a lot of things. She stated they don’t
follow the rules. She reported Youth A left the facility last
Thursday, however, she does not know why or where she went to.
She stated that there are enough staff to intervene and feels staff
respond right away when an incident happens.
Documentation Received:
• Youth’s A safety plan dated for 3/3/2025. The safety plan
stated that Youth A is easily agitated, verbal aggression
(using exploitive) and she will verbalize, “I’m feeling
impulsive”. Youth A struggles with self-harm, suicidal
thoughts, depression, mood swings, poor appetite and
anxiety. The plan of action for Youth A: follow direction
given by the Spectrum Team, must be willing to be open
and receptive to staff to establish support, different meal
time from peers, random bedroom checks, and when asked
to be separate, must comply. The plan of action for
Spectrum Team: will present a trauma informed approach,
will present a strength based approach to all youth, will
prioritize the safety of all youth to help all youth feel safe
and free from threat, will encourage all youth to participate
in their treatment plan and will follow all emergency
procedures during a crisis. The time frame for the safety
plan is the length of placement.
• Unusual Incident Report dated 3/6/25: Youth A yelled at a
youth that they smell fishy and needs to wash in between
their legs. Youth A kept saying it and not following
directions after being re-directed by Staff 5.
• Unusual Incident Report dated 3/6/25: Youth A’s bra got
stuck in the washer machine and staff had to cut the bra
strap. Staff informed Youth A that they would buy her a new
bra and Youth A was okay with this.
• Unusual Incident Report dated 3/9/25: Youth B reported
Youth A had a weed vape pen. Youth B only decided to tell
because Youth A wouldn’t let her use the vape pen. Both
youth began to argue. Youth A is not following the program
rules.
• Unusual Incident Report dated for 3/11/25: Youth A was
suspended from school on 3/10/25 for failure to comply.
Youth A did not follow the suspension and still went to
school on 3/11/25 and the school called for Youth A to be
picked up.
7

• Letter from schools, dated 3/10/25: Youth A is suspended
for 2 days for failure to comply with personnel. Youth is
able to return to school on 3/12/25.
Analysis The agency is in compliance per staff interviews. The agency staff
did respond to incidents in a timely and appropriate manner.
Technical Assistance
Technical assistance was provided regarding youth safety plans in
ensuring timely and clear communication is provided to all staff
when a youth has a safety plan established so staff are aware as
soon as possible.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Title Incident reporting.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4150
Section (4) When a resident’s behavior results in contact with law
Description enforcement, the incident shall be reported to the parent/legal
guardian, responsible referring agency, and the licensing authority
as soon as possible, but not more than 24 hours after the incident.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility failed to report Youth A contact with law enforcement to
licensing within 24 hours.
Investigation DCWL Consultant was interviewed over the phone on
3/14/2025. DCWL Consultant reported that she has not received
any communication from the agency of law enforcement being
involved for the month of March 2025.
Staff 1 was interviewed during an unannounced visit at the
facility on 3/14/2025. On 3/11/2025, Youth B threw a chair at
Youth A and law enforcement was called to the facility. The police
stated that the chair is considered a weapon, and they took Youth
B to a Juvenile Detention Facility (JDF). She does not report law
enforcement incidents to DCWL. She is unsure if law enforcement
has been involved prior to the incident on 3/11/2025.
Program Manager was interviewed during an unannounced
visit at the facility on 3/14/2025. Program Manager reported that
the case manager or Chief Administrator will contact DCWL when
law enforcement is involved.
Staff 3 was interviewed during an unannounced visit at the
facility on 3/14/2025. Staff 3 reported that when an incident
report is written, the report is then submitted and reviewed by the
8

supervisor. She stated that notifications of law enforcement are
sent to Program Manager and Chief Administrator.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed over the phone on
4/24/2025. The CA reported Program Manager or case manager
will email DCWL Consultant when law enforcement is involved
with their youth. She reported that if Program Manager or case
manager forgets to email the consultant, then she will. She stated
that they may have forgotten to do this. She reported there is not a
policy specifically stating to email DCWL when law enforcement is
involved. She also reported that she only verbally told Program
Manager and case manager to email DCWL. She admitted the
facility has dropped the ball when it comes to emailing DCWL
according to the policies.
Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone on 5/5/2025. Staff 5
stated that staff are required to write an incident report and then
send it to their supervisor. She is not required to contact DCWL
when law enforcement is involved. She also reported that she
does not know what happens once the incident report is submitted
to the supervisor.
Documentation Received:
• Unusual Incident Report dated 3/8/25: Youth A and B
began beating on the bathroom door while another Youth A
was in the bathroom. Youth A was demanding for her to
come out. Youth A got a spoon from the kitchen and was
able to open the bathroom door. The Romulus police were
called and report #250004329.
• Unusual Incident Report dated 3/8/25: Youth A and B
appeared to be high on an unknown substance and was
disrespectful to staff by spraying staff with a bottle water.
The Romulus police were called and Youth A and B were
taken by the police; report #250004331.
• Unusual Incident Report dated 3/8/25: Youth A and C
began to fight over Youth A hitting Youth C with a broom.
Police were called and Youth A were taken by the police;
report #250004342.
• Unusual Incident Report: Youth E punched Youth A in the
face due to Youth A not staying in her room when asked by
staff. Police were called and talked to Youth A. She
declined medical treatment.
• Unusual Incident Report dated 3/11/25: Youth A and B
were in two altercations and Youth B threw a chair and
remote at Youth A. The police were called and took Youth
B to a JDF for assault and battery; report #250004588.
9

Analysis The agency is non-compliance per staff and DCWL interviews of
not informing their licensing consultant as soon as possible, but
not more than 24 hours of a youth’s contact with law enforcement.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2024C0000858SI dated 12/1/23, CAP approved 12/27/23
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
